Reviews.Title: “We made it a value”
Reviews.Author: Carly R
Reviews.Content: We were here for a girls' weekend, celebrating a birthday. The attendants were very helpful (even though we really didn't want them to be, since we couldn't afford to tip them!) and our room was very clean and quiet. We were a little disappointed we couldn't use the amenities of the adjoining JW Marriott, but the gym here was actually pretty nice and you could tell that the property had been updated recently so as to better accompany the shiny new JW. Our parking wasn't included, but we found nearby street parking where we left the car all weekend. We walked to Circle Centre mall (you can walk to most places downtown, including the canal, statehouse, and other government buildings) and cabbed to Broad Ripple for about $20 each way. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ret1sg82abn
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve here and had a very nice stay. This is part of a very large complex of four hotels. The staff even though busy was quite nice and helpful. The free breakfast was one of the better I've had at a hotel. Besides all of the standard things they had Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches in a small fridge to heat and have; a good addition. The room although a little small was very nice a clean. The easy access to the restaurants and bars in the other hotels were a big plus. From this hotel you can get to a whole lot of places in downtown Indianapolis without even walking out side.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Fairfield downtown in Indianapolis in December 2011. Parking was included in our room rate, which was a good deal, otherwise the rates looked expensive. Check-in was easy and quick, and the room was quiet, clean, and modern. The bed was comfortable, with what seemed like a new mattress, which made sleep comfortable and easy. Breakfast was of the cheap variety, but you get what you pay for, and anyway, there were lots of options on offer including some sort of microwaveable sandwiches (which I stayed well away from, since that's not my thing). I am sure that on busy days the breakfast room can become crowded, but this was not the case when we stayed. The location of this hotel is great: a quick walk into central downtown and with great access to museums too: the Eiteljorg museum of Native American art and crafts is right across the road, and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Convention Center & Stadiums”
Reviews.Author: roadtripblondie
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this property for the Big 10 Championship game. Wish I could have stayed longer. Location was perfect not only for the game at Lucas Oil Stadium, but for the related NCAA events at the Indianapolis Convention Center. There is a conglomerate of all Marriott chains in the immediate area. There are indoor walkways between the hotels and convention center; no need to battle inclement weather or cross busy downtown streets. While there are numerous eating establishments within blocks, there is a TGI Friday's in the Fairfield building. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Complementary breakfast plentiful with adequate seating. There is a daily fee for parking in the adjacent structure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Janene R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came into town for a Colts game. We loved that we were in walking distance to the stadium and could also walk all around downtown using the Sky Walk. It was convenient that there were 4 Marriott's in one place each having different amenities that we could use. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The front office staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “small room; good location”
Reviews.Author: katgreen
Reviews.Content: Location: The Fairfield downtown is a great location and provides easy access to everything. The hotel is in walking distance to the downtown shopping and restaurants, sports stadiums, museums, zoo and park areas. Parking: The underground parking is substantial and serves four hotels (all Marriott properties). We reserved through the Marriott website and received free parking (otherwise $23/day). Be sure to print the rate code stating that parking is included (the front desk clerk needed the written copy). Room: We reserved a king room. Our room looked out over the Indiana State Museum. Pretty decent view. The size of the room was pretty small but manageable. The room had a microwave, small refrigerator, nice sized bathroom and desk area. All of the colors were vibrant and welcoming and the room was in great condition. Overall hotel: Clean and accommodating. The breakfast area was bright and comfortable. Breakfast was the standard bagels, muffins, fruit, waffles, juice, coffee, etc... Final verdict: We would stay again if in Indy. A pretty decent Fairfield in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute and perfect”
Reviews.Author: DallasTricia
Reviews.Content: We drove into Indianapolis after visiting friends and family in Davenport, Iowa and Peoria, IL. Our three-month-old was with us, so I was a little nervous about not having made reservations or done much research prior to visiting. Any concerns I had disappeared when we arrived and the front desk manager gave us a great rate and a comfortable corner room (702). It faced the Indiana State Museum and the Eitglborg. The bed was very comfy. There's a TGI Friday's in the building and they deliver to your room. That was especially nice after a long day on the road. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location can't be beat and Indy in general is just a beautiful urban environment. We were in town to visit the Capitol ( our 17th U.S. Capitol building) and the Fairfield was the perfect place for us. The garage parking underground was very convenient. It connects the Fairfield with the JW and Spring Hill Suites. All of them are situated on the same city block, clustered together. You can't go wrong with any of these, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: libser
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here during the weekend festivities of my nephew's wedding. Most of the family and friends stayed at the Canterbury Hotel but since that hotel would not let more than 2 people stay in a room; I looked around for a close hotel that served breakfast. I am a Marriott Rewards Silver member and have stayed in many, many Marriott hotels. This hotel is new, cleverly decorated and in the same area as the new JW Marriott and Springhill Suites. The hotel staff was very pleasant, courteous and on the ball. I like when the hotel staff reply "my pleasure" after the guest requests something (extra hangers, where the closest ATM is, etc.) Hotel underground parking is shared wtih the other 2 hotels above and the nice thing is that you can walk all the way to the City Center Mall (approx 4 blocks away) without going outside. Very nice-especially if you have a tween girl who just got her hair fixed for her cousin's wedding. Only thing I could possibly find fault in was that the rate was high (a conference was in town) and there was no convenience store easily accessible. Good location (right next to Lucas Oil Stadium) and excellent customer service. Only thing

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, fabulous staff, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: lissabiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late July for a family wedding... so we had family ALL over this hotel and the JW Marriott next door. The beds we super comfortable, the bathrooms were HUGE and clean, the room decor was modern and fun, and the free breakfast was better than I expected (everything from bagels & fruit to waffles & bacon, egg, and cheese sandwiches). Having TGIFridays next door was convenient for family meals, but the restaurant over at the JW was really excellent if you want something you can't get just anywhere. The wedding was right across the street at the Indiana State Museum (an easy walk with our stroller - multiple crosswalks), and our room looked directly at the Museum (although other family member's rooms had "nice" views of brick walls lol). A family member stayed in one of the suites, which was very nice as well (the two rooms aren't separated by a door/wall, but they are definitely separate spaces and a lot of extra room + fridge). The staff was VERY accommodating, especially given that they were incredibly busy -- three weddings staying there that weekend and the hotel was completely booked! Parking was expensive, but we flew in (took the $8/person shuttle to the hotel), so we didn't have to worry about that. In all, great hotel, great staff, and a great time had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice in 2 weeks - great experience”
Reviews.Author: lushou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife's family one weekend and with my wife the weekend prior. The hotel is in a great location central to 80% of Indy's attractions. The staff is excellent and accommodating. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Great Hotel!!!!! Great Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on July 3, 2011. We were very pleasantly surprised at the decor and recent updates. There's a great little bistro at the front entrance, providing a great area to sit & chat. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The amazing thing we found was the staff. From check in to check out - nothing but great experiences. If Mariott could clone these people for the rest of the hotels - they'd have a monoply of the hotel business. Everyone was friendly and helpful - especially Claude in the Valet Service. We had forgotten tickets in our car and Claude cheerfully retrieved them and delivered them to us. I'm sure it was an inconvenience as he went out of his way, but I couldn't tell it by his demeanor. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel if your in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: RLSMiami
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during the Indy 500 festivities. Excellent central location - walking distance to most everything downtown. It is physically connected to the JW Marriott which has a nice restaurant and lounge indoors and another one adjacent to the entrance to the Fairfield outdoors, there's also a TGIF for those so inclined. Very professional and welcoming front desk staff - they moved us to a room away from the elevators without a problem and let us know about the airport shuttle that picks up right across street from hotel entrance - extremely convenient. The room facilities themselves are quite acceptable. The only slightly negative experience was that there wasn't a "Do Not Disturb" door tag in our room which we mentioned to the room attendant who nevertheless attempted to enter the room without first knocking on the morning of our departure. Other than that obvious faux pas - a very nice stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very clean hotel. Pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: peacepax
Reviews.Content: This is a Fairfield Inn but compared to others in that category this is a notch above. Great value since downtown Indianapolis hotels are surprisingly pricey. Hotel provides free breakfast, good choices. Breakfast area does get crowded, I was staying there when a big conference was going on so I had to take my food to my hotel room. Very nice and clean rooms, not your typical Fairfield Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Customer-service is excellent and hotel is brand new and emaculate”
Reviews.Author: natalie728
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old daughter and I stayed at the Fairfield this past weekend as we were in town for a cheer competition. We were extremely pleased with our stay. The staff could not have been more kind and accommodating. They always asked how your were and what they could do for you. Ben was of the upmost professionalism. The complimentary business center in the lobby was a nice amenity and the internet was high-speed. The breakfast buffet was extremely well run and was constantly being replenished and the tables wiped to allow more patrons to sit and eat. The selection of breakfast food was very good. Our room was a little small as we only had one bed in the room. However, it was more than adequate for our stay and since it is brand new, everything was so fresh and clean. The color scheme and carpeting colors were very pleasing too. The location to the convention center was just one block away and as soon as the JW Marriott opens up everything will be connected by a skywalk. Even so, the walk to the convention center was very close and we even had lots of snow to contend with! There is a busstop right across the street and the Green Zone bus from the airport stops right across from the Fairfield. This made it very convenient since we didn't have the extra expense of a cab. The TGIF restaurant is connected to the Fairfield and we ate there twice. It was so convenient. Great place to stay and very affordable. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “So not stay here, courtyard, or springhill suites until JW done in March. All night construction on JW.”
Reviews.Author: Drew12344
Reviews.Content: Usually a big Marriott fan, and gold member, but worst experience ever. They must be behind on JW as they did construction all night. Called front desk, since drilling kept me up from 1-4am, and they said sorry but the crew is working during nights. Courtyard, springhill, and fairfield are all connected so avoid until March.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price. Small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: Look, it's a Fairfield Inn and that makes it one of Marriott's lowest end property. I usually only like to stay at Courtyard and above, but I knew this was a newer property so I gave it a chance. Place is very clean, with a Fridays connected to it. So that was nice. The rooms were tiny but modern with a new 32" flat screen TV. I stayed in a room with two beds, and they were double beds, not queens. I would not want to stay in a room this small with an extra person as it would be crowded. Not a lot of frills, but clean, new and a good value. There is a Courtyard next store and I would probably elect to stay there next time as I prefer a larger room. I pricelined this room and got is 2.5 stars for $45 a night.

Reviews.Title: “terrific place to stay in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: owassotraveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel downtown. We walked (15-20 minutes) to Monument Circle. There are LOTS of places to eat w/in walking distance and TGI Friday's is next door (and provides the room service for this hotel). Hotel is new, clean, convenient--a step above my normal "middle of the road" hotel choice. I pre-paid on Priceline and got a reasonable rate ($102 + tax, senior rate). Self-parking is $20 in the attached garage. You have in-and-out privileges from the time you check in until 6:00 pm on the evening of check out. We left the car in the garage most of the time, as we were able to walk to many of the things we wanted to see and that was much easier than trying to find another place to park close to the attractions. The hotel is across the street from the Indiana State Museum, NCAA Hall of Champions Museum and White River State Park (which is where the zoo is).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: gstock
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Red Bull Moto Grand Prix from 8/26-29. Hotel is new. What else can be said. It is just a 10 minute walk to Monument Circle in the heart of downtown. Staff was very friendly and very accommodating. Rooms are very nice and amenities are ample. Ask for a room with a park view.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Fairfield now, as the new hotel feel will wear off soon”
Reviews.Author: dotdty86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new Fairfield Inn in downtown Indianapolis for Drum Corps events at the Lucas Oil Stadium and for other vacation activities. It is in a great location for access to the stadium, convention center, museums, White River Park / Zoo and within a reasonable walk of most other downtown sites. This hotel has been open for just a few months and still has all the cleanliness of a new hotel. However, I get a clear sense that once the new hotel gleam wears off, there will be some problems: - Breakfast was underwhelming in terms of selection, service and crowd control. Among other items, the hotel provides microwaveable breakfast sandwiches and do-it-yourself waffles. However, with only one microwave, two waffle makers and no real sense of a line or queue, breakfast was sort of a free-for-all mess. - There were some design quirks with our room, a king suite. In the bathroom, you couldn't reach the towel rack from the shower. The in-room AC was pretty loud and the room lighting didn't really reach all corners. - I also found that the value of this hotel was lacking for the price. In Marriott terms, you pay Courtyard-level prices for Fairfield amenities. - Finally, the underground parking garage worked out fine for this trip. However, I would be greatly concerned about future visits, as the garage looks it services not only the Fairfield but also the attached Courtyard, Springhill Suites and JW Marriott. The JW isn't open yet but will have 900+ rooms. Some of the garage is not yet open, but unless there are vast levels that have yet to be unveiled, there is no way that garage will handle the demands from all four hotels. Bottom line is that if you get into the Fairfield in the next six months, you will likely have a nice enough stay in a new facility. After that, however, keep an eye out for better values.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dllbzrose_5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located right in the center of our activities. Could not ask for anything more convenient. We went to the State Museum (right across the street), Victory Field (a short walk out the back side of the hotel), and took a walk down to the Zoo. Our view from the hotel room was awesome. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel was full this weekend and we had no problem with the elevated as previously stated by some. The breakfast area was well stocked and even though very full, didn't have problem with finding what we needed. The room was alittle smaller than other hotel room but there were 3 of us and it worked out well. Could have used another chair other than the desk chair but other than that, the room was new and clean. Asked for some additional towels and they brought them within 10 mintues or less it seemed. Fridays restaurant was connected to the hotel and the meal we had there was also very good. Had not eaten in a Fridays for a few years because I did not care for the quality of the previous meal but had the Key West shrimp and it was very good - would go back again to both the restaurant and the hotel without hestiation.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel! Clean, and in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: skyeport
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel and likely will be back next time I get away to Indy for the weekend. The room was immaculately clean as you might expect from a brand new hotel and the staff seemed eager to serve. We had a room with two double beds that might be on the small size, but was fine. The view was great. The location was perfect for checking out museums and the zoo and walking along the canal. The hotel is also close to many restaurants within walking distance. I used the valet parking, but my friend used the self park, which I recommend. It is pretty easy in and out and slightly cheaper than the valet. The hotel is part of the new Marriott complex which includes a TGI Friday's and a couple of other hotels. I didn't use the exercise room, but it looked pretty swank. The breakfast was pretty average, but had bananas and apples so that helped.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place, GREAT stay!”
Reviews.Author: CowboyQuilter
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Indy to meet up with friends this past weekend and stayed at the newly refurbished Fairfield Inn. Being a single traveler in a big city, I got lost finding it, but once I pulled into their drive, they took over! The valets were SUPER nice and helpful, same at the front desk. The Inn is brightly furnished and the service was exceptional!! As a single traveler, I found the room-key-in-the-elevator safety feature made me feel much safer. The room was spotless, smelled fresh, the bed was WONDERFULLY soft! Loved it, loved the people, loved my stay. I'll see you again next year, Fairfield!!

Reviews.Title: “Who can complain about new? Great new option in downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this former Courtyard (now a Fairfield Inn) just after they re-opened. Looked like a new hotel to me. Room a bit small but brightly decorated. Bed comfortable. Not too noisy although room faced Washington Street. Connected to the newly re-opened TGI Friday's restaurant. This property is part of the 3 Marriotts (JW and Springhill being the other 2) being constructed. Across the street from the Eiteljorg Museum of Western Art. About 1/2 mile to NIFS Fitness Center and Circle Center Mall is about 5 blocks the other direction. Room temperature was a bit cool on a frosty winter night. Also front desk clerk claimed the AAA rate was higher than their lowest rate (it wasn't). For a Fairfield, this property is much better than the average Fairfield and doesn't seem to suffer from the flimsy construction that the orignial Fairfield Inn's did. This property was also the cheapest option dowtown save for the Sheraton (the former downtown Radisson). Overall a great choice in downtown Indy. And who can complain about new: new TV, new linens, new bed, new carpeting....New is a rarity for a hotel these days. Recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 501 West Washington Street, Indianapolis, IN 46204
